page.title: 03Benson Stud, Horse Breeding
page.content: { Benson Stud,}off Harts Lane, has 47 stables but has only 25 horses at present. The horses are for racing. It costs Â£200,000 to look after them and Â£40 to keep one horse for a week. There are three stallions and the oldest is 10 years old. 20 of the mares have given birth and the youngest foal is two months old. { Glenoram}is the most expensive horse bought for{Â£100,000,}and{Sparkling Boy winner of 4 races{has won Â£50,744. The horses are out in the paddocks and they eat the grass. In winter they have oats, bran and linseed to eat, and live in the stables. { Ben is the manager}and he has been working with horses for 13 years. He employs 4 full time workers. The{selling price}for the{stud}would be{Â£10,000,000.
